text: so this space and clinical trials is
really cool there's a lot of advances in
technology and that's what led us to
being overwhelmed with our own Prem
systems the new advances in sequencing
required 10x more compute and 10x more
storage and it just wasn't going to work
in an on-prem environment just the costs
and the management of that equipment so
I propose that we move or begin to
investigate going to the cloud and set
up a proof-of-concept with AWS to
explore what it would look like to run
our genomics pipelines in a cloud
environment so two-and-a-half years
later we have a petabyte of data stored
in AWS and a lot more data common we are
doing machine learning in support of our
clinical trials and so we're making
insights within minutes as compared to
hours or days or weeks what it used to
be we're running our genomics pipelines
we had a case where a client wanted us
to do a job for them that would have
required literally five or six hundred
high-power compute and they wanted an
answer within days there's no way we
could even procure that amount of
hardware let alone purchase it but one
called at AWS we were able to stand that
up within hours and satisfy this client
so it's phenomenal you know new
opportunities we have now because of AWS
that we didn't have with an on-prem
environment know that AWS is committed
to your success they're going to help
you get started they're gonna make it
easy for you to learn and understand and
navigate what may be overwhelming at
first they're gonna be there for you and
they're gonna help you get there they
want you to succeed and you'll see over
time and time again that they really are
invested in their customers
